application.name: std2isis
application.brief: Imports a cube from PNG, JPEG, JP2, BMP or TIFF format
application.description: This program will import several standard image formats to an Isis cube. The input image formats may include PNG, JPEG, JP2, TIFF, BMP, and GIF. Not all formats are available as the program implementation depends on the Qt library by TrollTech. This is not true of JPEG2000 files (JP2). It has support in the ISIS3 library. By default, the number of bands in the output cube will be one, three, and four when the input image is all gray, RGB, and RGB with an alpha channel, respectively. The user can, however, specify the color mode manually. The JP2 file can have any number of bands up to 16384. The output from a JP2 file will be a multi-spectral ISIS3 image file.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the filename to import.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: Use this parameter to specify the name of the output cube.

parameter.name: MODE
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the image mode for the output cube. If GRAYSCALE, a single one-band cube will be created. If RGB, a three-band cube is created. Finally, if ARGB is selected, then a four-band cube will be created where the four bands correspond to first Red, second Green, third Blue, and last Alpha.

option.description: Checks to see if the image is a grayscale image, and if not, if it has an alpha channel, and sets the output mode accordingly.
A three-channel image (red, green, and blue).
A four-channel image (red, green, blue, and alpha).

parameter.name: SETNULLRANGE
parameter.description: If this option is used input raw pixels below minimum and above maximum will be converted to LRS and HRS respectively. Otherwise pixels in the input raw file will be left unchanged in most cases. For example, importing a raw 8-bit file and outputing to a 16-bit or 32-bit real will cause 0 and 255 to be actual values. If left as 8-bit then 0 will be NULL and 255 will be HRS.

parameter.name: NULLMIN
parameter.description: Minimum valid value. Anything below this value will be set to LRS.

parameter.name: NULLMAX
parameter.description: Maximum valid value. Anything above this value will be set to HRS.

example.brief: Converting an image to an Isis Cube in Automatic mode
example.description: This example will show the conversion from a color PNG image to a cube, automatically determining the color mode. Here, the output image will be a four-band ARGB cube, because the input image is both in color, and has an alpha channel.

terminalInterface.description: Convert the PNG to an Isis Cube, with the default option of automatically determining the color mode

image.description: Screenshot of the GUI for std2isis, ready to convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube argb.cub, with mode left at its default of AUTOMATIC.

thumbnail.caption: Convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube argb.cub

image.description: The input image, a color PNG in this example.
The four-band ARGB output image viewed in black-and-white with a grayscale.

The same four-band ARGB output image viewed in color with RGB filtering (Band 1 = Red, Band 2 = Green, Band 3 = Blue). Note that the image here appears brighter than the original, because qview has auto-stretched the DN values, and can be adjusted back with qview's "stretch" tool. The actual data, however, has not been changed.
The same four-band ARGB output image viewed in color with RGB filtering as in the previous image, but here Band 4 (the alpha channel) is viewed through the Blue filter.

thumbnail.caption: Output Image in Color with Band 4 in Blue

example.brief: Converting an image to an Isis Cube in Grayscale mode
example.description: This example will show the conversion from a color PNG image to a cube, with the color mode set to GRAYSCALE, meaning that the output image will be a single-band black-and-white cube.

terminalInterface.description: Convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube gray.cub. In order to get a single-band black-and-white image, we set the mode equal to GRAYSCALE.

image.description: Screenshot of the GUI for std2isis, ready to convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube gray.cub with mode set to GRAYSCALE.

image.description: The input image, in this example, the same color PNG from the previous example.

example.brief: Converting an image to an Isis Cube in RGB mode
example.description: This example will show the conversion from a color PNG image to a cube, with the color mode set to RGB, meaning that the output image will be a three-band color cube.

terminalInterface.description: Convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube rgb.cub. In order to get a three-band color image, we set the mode equal to RGB.

image.description: Screenshot of the GUI for std2isis, ready to convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube rgb.cub with mode set to RGB.

thumbnail.caption: Convert the image input.png to the Isis Cube rgb.cub

image.description: The input image, in this example, the same color PNG from the first example.
The three-band RGB output image viewed in black-and-white with a grayscale.

The same three-band RGB output image viewed in color with RGB filtering (Band 1 = Red, Band 2 = Green, Band 3 = Blue). Once again, the output image appears to be brighter than the original due to qview's auto-stretching, but can be adjusted in qview with the "stretch" tool.
